Pre-Game Insights: Arden Zwelling and Ben Nicholson-Smith discuss how the Yankees can close out the series in Game 5 after taking a commanding 3-1 lead.
Big questions surround Cleveland closer Emmanuel Clase while the Yankees may be without three of their top relief arms as they attempt to win the pennant.
Guardians manager Stephen Vogt mentioned that the team has used their relievers a lot and everyone is tired.
Tanner Bibee will be pitching on short rest for the Guardians in Game 5.
The Yankees hit Bibee hard in Game 2 of the series, scoring three runs against him on the way to an eventual 6-3 win.
Carlos Rodón has the chance to make a significant impact on the ALCS for the second time, having given the Yankees six innings of one-run baseball while striking out nine in Game 1.
